articles.headline: Uber’s Business Model Could Change Your Work
articles.snippet: New technologies have the potential to divide a variety of traditional jobs into tasks that can be assigned to people just when they’re needed.
articles.abstract: New technologies have the potential to divide a variety of traditional jobs into tasks that can be assigned to people just when they’re needed.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Uber has grown to become one of the world’s most valuable start-ups, its ambitions often seem limitless.

articles.headline: States Renew Fight to Stop Same-Sex Marriage
articles.snippet: Despite rulings declaring bans on same-sex marriage unconstitutional in their states, some state legislators have introduced bills that would prohibit the issuing of marriage licenses to gay couples.
articles.abstract: Despite rulings declaring bans on same-sex marriage unconstitutional in their states, some state legislators have introduced bills that would prohibit the issuing of marriage licenses to gay couples.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S.C. — As the nation waits for the Supreme Court to decide whether same-sex marriages should be legal nationwide, another, more mundane front has opened in the wedding wars: the offices of the state and local officials who perform civil marriages and issue licenses.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Federal Reserve Won’t Raise Interest Rates Before June, at Earliest
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve gave its most upbeat economic assessment since the recession, though it did say inflation remains sluggish.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve gave its most upbeat economic assessment since the recession, though it did say inflation remains sluggish.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve kept its options open on Wednesday, signaling that it would not raise short-term interest rates any earlier than June, while leaving unresolved how much longer it might be willing to wait before lifting its benchmark rate from near zero, where the central bank has held it for more than six years.

articles.headline: All-but-Forgotten Prisoner in Jordan Is at Center of Swap Demand by ISIS
articles.snippet: The Islamic State has said that if a failed suicide bomber, Sajida al-Rishawi, is not released by Jordan, it will kill a Japanese and a Jordanian hostage.
articles.abstract: The Islamic State has said that if a failed suicide bomber, Sajida al-Rishawi, is not released by Jordan, it will kill a Japanese and a Jordanian hostage.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMMAN, Jordan — During the nine years that Sajida al-Rishawi, 46, has been sitting in self-imposed solitary confinement in her cell at the Juweidah Women’s Prison in Jordan, refusing to mix with other prisoners, she has had hardly any visitors, other than her court-appointed lawyer.
articles.byline: By Rod Nordland and Ranya Kadri

articles.headline: Oil Company Sasol Delays Huge Louisiana Project as Prices Slide
articles.snippet: The $14 billion project, which had not received final approval from Sasol, was to begin production in 2018, creating some 1,200 permanent jobs.
articles.abstract: The $14 billion project, which had not received final approval from Sasol, was to begin production in 2018, creating some 1,200 permanent jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — In the biggest retrenchment in the United States as oil prices fall, Sasol has delayed an expansive $14 billion project in southwestern Louisiana to make diesel out of natural gas.

articles.headline: Homeowners in Poland Borrowed in Swiss Francs, and Now Pay Dearly
articles.snippet: Switzerland’s move to untie its currency from the euro has caused the franc to soar, along with hundreds of thousands of mortgage payments in Poland.
articles.abstract: Switzerland’s move to untie its currency from the euro has caused the franc to soar, along with hundreds of thousands of mortgage payments in Poland.
articles.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Piotr Szczepaniak, an apartment manager here, had just finished work, checking faucets and making sure rents were paid. After making himself a coffee, he logged on to a Polish social network and noticed that someone had posted the current exchange rate of the Swiss franc.

articles.headline: Why You Should Tell Your Children How Much You Make
articles.snippet: Discussions about family finances can start early and fit a child’s age and ability to understand, but they shouldn’t be avoided.
articles.abstract: Discussions about family finances can start early and fit a child’s age and ability to understand, but they shouldn’t be avoided.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Scott Parker wanted his six offspring to know more about the value of money, he decided to do something that many parents would consider radical: show them exactly what he earned.
